questions.question: What is the empirical formula of the compound 2a?
What type of crystal system does the compound 5a belong to?
What is the yield percentage of the hydroamination product 2a under optimized reaction conditions?
Is the molecular structure of 4-(THF)3 determined by X-ray crystallography?
Does the reaction of pTolNCO with 1 in the presence of NHPh2 afford 5a in a higher yield compared to the reaction without NHPh2?
questions.answer: Yes, the presence of NHPh2 increases the yield to 81%.

questions.question: What is the role of the amine in the hydroamination reaction of isocyanates catalyzed by sodium magnesiates?
questions.answer: The role of the amine is to generate in situ the active species 3 which can then undergo subsequent insertion reactions with isocyanates.

questions.question: Can sodium magnesiates effectively promote the trimerization of arylisocyanates at room temperature without forming other oligomers?
questions.answer: Yes, sodium magnesiates can effectively promote the trimerization of arylisocyanates at room temperature in a selective manner without forming other oligomers.

questions.question: What is the yield of isocyanurate 5a when the reaction is carried out using sodium magnesiate 3-(THF)2?
Is the formation of isocyanurate 5a an example of a catalytic process where the synergistic Naâ€“Mg partnership is demonstrated?
What is the crystal system and space group of the compound 5a?
What is the role of sodium in the catalytic cycle for sodium-magnesiate-mediated hydroamination and trimerization of isocyanates?
questions.answer: Sodium's cationic component enables further activation of the organic electrophile RNCO by coordination, bringing it into close proximity with the anionic magnesiate component for selective transfer of an amido group.

questions.question: Does the presence of THF affect the formation of the tris(amido) species in the catalytic process?
questions.answer: Yes, THF acts as a solvent that facilitates the formation of tris(amido) species by solvating sodium in the absence of donor THF.

questions.question: What is the yield of the hydroamination product 2a when the reaction is carried out using 1.15 equivalents of Ph2NH?
Is the yield of the hydroamination reaction of isocyanates with N-methylaniline higher than with 2,20-dipyridylamine?
questions.answer: Yes, the yield is significantly higher with N-methylaniline compared to 2,20-dipyridylamine.

questions.question: What is the effect of the steric bulk of the R substituent on the hydroamination/trimerization of isocyanates catalyzed by sodium magnesiates?
questions.answer: The steric bulk of the R substituent affects the selectivity of the reaction, with bulkier substituents promoting hydroamination and less bulky, more electrophilic substituents favoring trimerization.

questions.question: What is the yield of isocyanurate 5b when synthesized using sodium magnesiate 3-(THF)2?
Is the yield of the hydroamination reaction of isocyanates with bis(trimethylsilyl)amine HMDS(H) higher than with diaryl amines?
questions.answer: No, the hydroamination reaction with bis(trimethylsilyl)amine HMDS(H) is totally inhibited, whereas diaryl amines react in near quantitative yields.

questions.question: What is the crystal system of the compound 4-(THF)3?
Does the catalytic process for the hydroamination and trimerization of isocyanates involve a cooperative behaviour of Na and Mg?
questions.answer: Yes, the cooperative behaviour of Na and Mg is crucial for the catalytic process, enhancing both nucleophilicity and electrophilicity.

questions.question: What is the yield of the trimerization product 5a when the reaction is carried out in the absence of NHPh2?
